properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 29 at 3:03AM MST until March 1 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Winter Storm Watches Posted for Portions of Central and
Southern Wyoming late tonight through Sunday evening...

.Snow will develop late tonight and continue through the day
Sunday. The snow is likely to persist across southern Wyoming
Sunday evening. The combination of snow and wind could create
hazardous travel in some locations.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12
inches is possible. Northeast wind gusting 25 to 35 mph from
Red Canyon across South Pass along Wyoming Highway 28 on Sunday
will cause travel problems.

* WHERE...Wind River Mountains, East Slopes.

* WHEN...From late this evening through Sunday evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult over South Pass due
to blowing snow reducing visibility. Cold wind chills as low
as 20 below zero in the mountains could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected to fall
Sunday morning and afternoon.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING
